what: Assign a Custom Name to the Timings Object
title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: want give dataframe different name, can pass name constructor:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer("mytimes");   timer.tic();   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc();   return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ## [1] -0.4000435 print(mytimes) ##        Microseconds SD    Min    Max Count ## tictoc       12.163  0 12.163 12.163     1

title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: may need handle resulting DataFrame instead letting rcpptimer write global environment. issue actually consists two elements: Turn autoreturn feature Handle results First, turn autoreturn feature, set autoreturn variable timer class false. prevent timer writing results global environment. Now, mem write global environment. However, can still access results timer’s .stop() method: also possible use .stop() let rcpptimer pass results automatically. example, just set autoreturn true (default) delete line.
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.autoreturn = false;   timer.tic("rnorm");   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc("rnorm");   return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ## [1] 1.255317 print(ls()) ## [1] "demo_rnorm" Rcpp::cppFunction(' DataFrame demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.autoreturn = false;   timer.tic("rnorm");   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc("rnorm");   DataFrame times = timer.stop();   return(times); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ##       Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count ## rnorm        7.013  0 7.013 7.013     1

title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: package author, parameterize auto-return feature users can decide whether want results passed global environment name assigned. example .
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm(bool return_timings = false,                 const char* timings_name = "times") {   Rcpp::Timer timer(timings_name);   timer.autoreturn = return_timings;   timer.tic("rnorm");   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc("rnorm");   return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm(return_timings = FALSE) ## [1] 0.9944287 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" demo_rnorm(return_timings = TRUE) ## [1] 1.621553 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" "times" demo_rnorm(return_timings = TRUE, timings_name = "my_times") ## [1] 2.148412 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" "my_times"   "times"

title: Adding rcpptimer to a Package
text: Using rcpptimer package simple. Just link DESCRIPTION file: add header .cpp file #include <rcpptimer.h>. Now, can create use instance Rcpp::Timer class. Consider fibonacci_omp function: function available rcpptimer can try , e.g. rcpptimer::fibonacci(n = rep(15:20, 10)). can observe timings executing print(times). see, writes timings global environment data.frame called times. Read following section learn want package.
code: LinkingTo: rcpptimer (>= 1.2.0) #include <rcpptimer.h>  long int fib(long int n) {   return ((n <= 1) ? n : fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); }  //[[Rcpp::export]] std::vector<long int> fibonacci_omp(std::vector<long int> n) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;  // This scoped timer measures the total execution time of 'fibonacci'   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scpdtmr(timer, "fib_body");   std::vector<long int> results = n;   #pragma omp parallel for   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n.size(); ++i)   {     timer.tic("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));     results[i] = fib(n[i]);     timer.toc("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));   }   return (results); }

title: Adding rcpptimer to a Package
text: using rcpptimer package, consider disabling timer’s autoreturn feature. Users package may aware functionality, may already object named times global environment, may strict expectations objects want write environment. Instead, include timings data structures parameterize name returned object, autoreturn feature , . See vignette("autoreturn") vignette read detail.

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: Initializing timer simple. four constructors available. default constructor initializes timer warnings enabled write results data.frame called “times” R environment: throughout vignettes, use four needed.
code: Rcpp::Timer timer;                    // default constructor Rcpp::Timer timer("my_timer");        // Set a custom name for the results Rcpp::Timer timer(false);             // Disable warnings Rcpp::Timer timer("my_timer", false); // Set a custom name and disable warnings

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: Rcpp::cppFunction, must add depends argument function tell compiler want link ‘rcpptimer’ library C++ code. , can construct instance Timer class use tic toc methods measure time takes execute code block. , allocate memory something measure: function automatically write data frame called “times” R environment. Read autoreturn feature (.e., assign custom variable name manually handle results) vignette("autoreturn"). resulting times object class data.frame rcpptimer. load package, always use print.data.frame base R print Microseconds. load package, may scale measurements statistics readable (see rcpptimer::print.rcpptimer).
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(" double add(double &x, double &y) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.tic();   double z = x + y;   timer.toc();   return(z); }",   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -0.7992826 print(times) library(rcpptimer) print(times)

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: can also use multiple timers function. Just pass string tic toc methods identify timer: rcpptimer group multiple timers name calculate summary statistics . Consider advanced example, also uses OpenMP: function included rcpptimer, can execute right away:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.tic("body");   timer.tic("add");   double z = x + y;   timer.toc("add");   timer.toc("body");   return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -0.5396038  print(times) #>      Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count #> add         0.631  0 0.631 0.631     1 #> body        3.016  0 3.016 3.016     1 // fibonacci_omp.cpp std::vector<long int> fibonacci_omp(std::vector<long int> n) {    Rcpp::Timer timer;   // This scoped timer measures the total execution time of 'fibonacci'   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scpdtmr(timer, "fib_body");    std::vector<long int> results = n;    #pragma omp parallel for   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n.size(); ++i)  {  timer.tic("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));  results[i] = fib(n[i]);  timer.toc("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));  }    return (results); } results <- rcpptimer::fibonacci_omp(n = rep(20:25, 5)) print(times) #>          Microseconds     SD      Min      Max Count #> fib_20         31.971  8.824   26.739   47.548     5 #> fib_21         37.961  2.963   35.596   41.497     5 #> fib_22         82.149 18.311   69.029  113.512     5 #> fib_23        105.112 12.113   92.913  121.998     5 #> fib_24        192.639 19.524  161.671  214.229     5 #> fib_25        278.052 42.302  239.226  349.702     5 #> fib_body     1557.875  0.000 1557.875 1557.875     1

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: offer alternative tic-toc interface. ScopedTimer lets measure time takes object go scope. can adjust example use ScopedTimer instead: Note need initialize ScopedTimer. goes scope, automatically call timer.toc("mem").
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");   double z = x + y;   return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] 0.7273107  print(times) #>     Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count #> add        1.342  0 1.342 1.342     1

what: Warnings and how to disable them
title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: default setting warn timers started using .tic never stopped using .toc() vice versa. useful catch unmatched .tic() .toc() calls may unmatched due missing statements typos. example, following code produce two warnings: Note affect terminated timers ‘mem’. warnings occur runtime. Unfortunately, can’t check compile time. However, can turn warnings passing false constructor. useful need .toc() calls code blocks may get executed, e.g. conditional statements. example produce warnings:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");   timer.tic("add");   double z = x + y;   timer.toc("ad");   return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> Warning in add(rnorm(1), runif(1)): Timer "ad" not started yet.  #> Use tic("ad") to start the timer. #> [1] 0.9221172 print(times) #>     Microseconds SD     Min     Max Count #> add      213.869  0 213.869 213.869     1 Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {   Rcpp::Timer timer(false);   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");   timer.tic("add");   double z = x + y;   timer.toc("ad");   return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -1.419489  print(times) #>     Nanoseconds SD Min Max Count #> add         551  0 551 551     1

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jonathan Berrisch. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Berrisch J (2024). rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer 'OpenMP' Support. R package version 1.2.0.9000, https://github.com/BerriJ/rcpptimer, https://rcpptimer.berrisch.biz.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer with 'OpenMP' Support},   author = {Jonathan Berrisch},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.0.9000, https://github.com/BerriJ/rcpptimer},   url = {https://rcpptimer.berrisch.biz}, }

what: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: R Package provides Rcpp bindings cpptimer, simple tic-toc timer class benchmarking C++ code. ’s just simple, ’s blazing fast! sleek tic-toc timer class supports nested overlapping timers OpenMP parallelism. boasts nanosecond-level time resolution. Results (summary statistics) automatically passed back R data frame.

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: Install rcpptimer CRAN.

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: straightforward example using Rcpp::Timer Rcpp::cppFunction: timer object automatically write result R environment: Check Documentation : Setting multiple, nested, overlapping timers Using OpenMP parallelism Using rcpptimer SourceCpp Adding rcpptimer package
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(" double demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.tic();   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc();   return(x); }",   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() print(times)        Microseconds SD Count tictoc         5.48  0     1

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: Processes taking less nanosecond timed. Unmatched .tic() .toc() calls raise errors compile time. However, throw warnings runtime.

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: package (underlying cpptimer class) inspired zdebruine’s RcppClock. used package lot wanted add OpenMP support, alter process calculating summary statistics, apply series small adjustments. hope find useful.

title: Simple rcpptimer example — fibonacci
text: function timed following: int fib(int n) { return ((n <= 1) ? n : fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); } Runtime computations less n = 15 nearly unmeasurable.

title: Simple rcpptimer example using OpenMP — fibonacci_omp
text: function timed following: int fib(int n) { return ((n <= 1) ? n : fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); } Runtime computations less n = 15 nearly unmeasurable.

title: Simple rcpptimer example using OpenMP — fibonacci_omp

what: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
text: Prints times object scales timings appropriate. timings smaller 1 microsecond, timings printed nanoseconds. smallest timing higher Millisecond / Seconds / Minutes / Hours, timings printed unit threshold. behavior can disabled setting scale = FALSE.

title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
code: # S3 method for class 'rcpptimer' print(x, scale = TRUE, ...)

title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
text: x Object class rcpptimer scale Scale timings statistics human readable format ... arguments ignored

title: rcpptimer 1.2.0
text: stop() method Rcpp::Timer now returns DataFrame results. usefull want set autoreturn false manually handle results. also possible just call aggregate() access public variable data Rcpp::Timer. data map containing results (Names, Mean, Standard Deviation, Count). tag arguments tic(), toc() ScopedTimer() default values now. Existing vignettes got updated new vignette added package. rcpptimer now measures nanoseconds instead microseconds. Adds print.rcpptimer method print results timer object. cases timings scaled readable unit (e.g. milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours).

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-20

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: Add new Rcpp::CppTimer::ScopedTimer class. can used time lifespan object goes scope. useful timing duration function loop. fibonacci example updated use new class. Warn timers stopped aggregate called (matching toc() statement). Warn timers matching tic() statement found. Add verbose parameter Timer class control whether warnings printed (defaults true). Add introductory vignette package.

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: led segfault previous version. Fix reset() method working properly cases timers spread multiple methods. Fix non-default constructors Timer class. working properly previous version.

title: rcpptimer 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-05 initial release rcpptimer. based RcppClock contains number improvements: OpenMP support Auomatically returns results R soon C++ Object goes scope Fast computation Mean Standard Deviation results C++ Uses tic toc instead tick tock consistent R’s tictoc package Allways reports microseconds resolution Many performance improvements
